p: Contemporary climate change is occurring in a world pervasively altered by human activities, multiplying challenges for conservation and resource management [ 1]. To meet these challenges, scientists and natural resource managers are working together to develop guidelines for climate adaptation [ 2, 3]. A focus on areas resistant to ongoing climate change is increasingly suggested as a potential conservation strategy [ 4], yet lack of clarity on how to identify and manage these “climate change refugia” hampers practitioners [ 5].
